title: Isolating Pure Quadratic Zeeman Splitting
authors:
Arash Dezhang Fard, Marek Kopciuch, Yujie Sun, Przemys{\l}aw
  W{\l}odarczyk, Szymon Pustelny
abstract:
Nonlinear magnetic interactions provide access to complex quantum spin
dynamics and thus enable the study of intriguing physical phenomena. However,
these interactions are often dominated by the linear Zeeman effect, which can
complicate system dynamics and make their analysis more challenging. In this
article, we theoretically and experimentally introduce a method to induce the
quadratic Zeeman effect while effectively compensating for its linear
counterpart. By isolating the quadratic Zeeman contributions, we demonstrate
and analyze controlled superposition generation between specific magnetic
sublevels in room-temperature rubidium-87 atoms. This study opens avenues for
controlling any spin system, regardless of its total angular momentum, which we
plan to explore further in the context of quantum-state tomography and
engineering (e.g., spin squeezing).
